newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt's Misr Exterior Bank ups 1996 pft.
newsitem.headline: Egypt's Misr Exterior Bank ups 1996 pft.

text.p: Egypt's private-sector Misr Exterior Bank said on Monday its profits for distribution during calendar year 1996 rose to 53 million pounds ($15.6 million) from 46 million a year earlier.
The profits are equivalent to 72.6 pounds for each of the 730,000 shares, which last traded on the Egyptian stock exchange on January 14 at 1,000 pounds.
The bank did not post a dividend. In 1995, it distributed 21 pounds per share.
The bank's total balance sheet rose to 3.75 billion pounds at the end of 1996 from 2.80 billion a year ago, the bank said in a published announcement.
Total revenue increased to 110.66 million pounds form 96.91 million in 1995.
Customer deposits in 1996 also rose to 3.06 billion pounds from 2.39 billion in 1995.
Shareholders' funds at the end of December, 1996 were worth 221.78 million pounds against 191.02 million at the end of the previous year.
Misr Exterior Bank began in 1982 as a joint venture between the Egyptian state's Banque Misr and the Spanish bank Banco Exterior de Espana.
Both banks have reduced their stakes by selling to mutual funds and other investors. Banque Misr, once the dominant partner with 51 percent, held 19.39 percent of the equity at the end of 1996.
Banco Exterior de Espana has cut its stake from 40 percent to 29.34 percent.
The bank said earlier this year that the other shareholders were Egyptian individuals (14.44 percent), mutual funds (14.08 percent) and industrial establishments (11 percent).
Here are the bank's balance sheets on December 31, 1996, and one year earlier and its profit/loss accounts for 1996 and 1995 (all figures in millions of pounds):
